message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

The paper proposes a novel approach to exploit the distinctive invariant features in convolutional neural network by using Scale Invariant Feature Transform (SIFT) descriptor instead of the max-pooling layer. This approach is particularly relevant to computer vision tasks, which suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a new CNN model that combines the feature extraction capabilities of CNN model and rotation invariance of SIFT descriptor, which suggests that it may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also presents experimental results on the MNIST and fashionMNIST datasets, which suggests that it may belong to the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Finally, the paper uses SIFT descriptor to capture the orientation and spatial relationship of the features extracted by convolutional layer, which suggests that it may also belong to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category.
